chapter.title: SysInv API v1
chapter.para: Manage physical servers with the Titanium System Inventory API. This includes inventory collection and configuration of nodes, ports, interfaces, CPUs, disks, partitions, memory, and sensors. The API also supports alarm collection for fault events of the cloud itself as well as configuration of the cloud's SNMP interface.
The typical port used for the SysInv REST API is 6385. However, proper technique would be to look up the sysinv service endpoint in Keystone.

section.title: System
section.para: The cloud server cluster is represented internally by a unique object referred to as the system.

section.title: Clusters
section.para: A cluster within the cloud server is represented internally by a unique object referred to as the cluster.

section.title: Hosts
section.para: Hosts are the physical hosts or servers for the system.

section.title: Ports
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the physical ports of a host and their attributes.

section.title: Interfaces
section.para: These APIs allow the create, display, modify and delete of the L2 interfaces of a host.

section.title: CPUs
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the logical core(s) of the processor(s) on a host, and the display and modification of the cores assigned function.

section.title: Memory
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the size and usage of various memory areas of the NUMA nodes of a host. The modification of the size of these memory areas is also supported through these APIs. The different memory areas of a NUMA node of a host are:

listitem.para: Memory reserved for the Platform; where the Platform consists of the kernel and the cloud services,
Memory reserved for the virtual switch (Note: only on 'compute' hosts),
Memory reserved for the hosted VMs (Note: only on 'compute' hosts).

section.title: SensorGroup
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the operational state and configuration attributes of the sensorgroups of a host. section.title: Sensor
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the status and operational state of various sensor areas of a host. The modification of the certain sensor attributes is also supported through these APIs. Examples of different sensortypes are as defined for the sensorgroup.

section.title: Volume Groups
section.para: These APIs allow the creation, deletion, and displaying of LVM volume groups.

section.title: Physical Volumes
section.para: These APIs allow the creation, deletion, and displaying of LVM physical volumes.

section.title: Profiles
section.para: These APIs allow the create, display and delete of host profiles. This includes interface profiles, cpu profiles, and volume profiles. NOTE that the same record is used in the database for both hosts and host profiles.

section.title: DNS
section.para: The DNS is the Domain Name Server entity for the system.

section.title: NTP
section.para: The NTP is the Network Time Protocol entity for the system.

section.title: External OAM
section.para: The extoam is the External OAM entity for the system.

section.title: Infrastructure Subnet
section.para: The infra is the Infrastructure subnet entity for the system.

section.title: DRBD Configuration
section.para: The drbdconfig is the Distributed Replicated Block Device (DRBD) configuration entity for the system.

section.title: Alarms
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the Active Alarms in the system.

section.title: Event Log
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the Event Log in the system. The Event log contains both historical alarms and customer logs.

section.title: Event Suppression
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the Event Suppression state in the system.

section.title: Devices
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the pci devices of a host and their attributes.

section.title: LLDP Agents
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the lldp agents of a host and their attributes.

section.title: LLDP Neighbors
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the lldp neighbors of a host and their attributes.

section.title: Services
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the services running and their attributes

section.title: Service Nodes
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the service nodes and their attributes

section.title: Service Groups
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the service groups and their attributes

section.title: SDN Controllers
section.para: These APIs allow for the display and configuration of the SDN controllers that each of the compute nodes will connect to for the purpose of SDN manager interface (i.e. OVSDB connection). The SDN controllers configured are for active connections to the SDN controller for each of the virtual switch instances running on the compute nodes, and is shared across all compute nodes.

section.title: Remote Logging
section.para: These APIs allow the display and configuration of the remote logging settings

section.title: Networks
section.para: These APIs allow the display of system managed networks. They are intended for internal system use only.

section.title: Address Pools
section.para: These APIs allow the display and configuration of IP address pools.

section.title: Addresses
section.para: These APIs allow the display and configuration of IP addresses for a specific host resource.

section.title: Routes
section.para: These APIs allow the display and configuration of IP route for a specific host resource.

section.title: Storage Backends
section.para: These APIs allow the display and configuration of different storage backends.

section.title: Storage Tiers
section.para: These APIs allow the create, display, modify and delete of the storage tiers.

section.title: Controller Filesystem
section.para: These APIs allow the display and configuration of the controller filesystem.

section.title: Ceph Monitors
section.para: These APIs allow the display and configuration of the Ceph monitors.

section.title: System Health
section.para: These APIs allow the display of the system health.

section.title: Software Loads
section.para: These APIs allow the display and configuration of the software loads.

section.title: Software Upgrade
section.para: These APIs allow the display and configuration of the software upgrade.

section.title: System Certificate Configuration
section.para: These APIs allow for the display and configuration of Host certificates which include SSL, Murano and Trusted Platform Module(TPM) certificates.

section.title: Custom Firewall Rules
section.para: These APIs allow for the installation of custom firewall rules.

section.title: License
section.para: These APIs allow for the installation of license file and display of the license information.
